column4: Sirs, where can I find an explanation of what each repository means?
hi sirs, when I enable all the repositories in the synaptic, would the installer try find the package in the CD first and then shift to the net if not available?
I believe it checks the CD first if that line is not #'d in the sources.list
anyway I can tell whether the package is on the CD or not in advance?
....not sure, never tried.  is there something you're looking for specifically?
no I am new and can't yet understand all this universe, multiverse, restricted stuff! Now when I see: Base System, Base System (universe), Base System (restricted) what does this mean?
those are the repositories (or databases) where you have programs available to you
ok but what's the difference and why I have three base systems?
they each hold different files.. just organization
there is one for security updates, one for base files, etc..
Umm! so now if I want to install things like flash or play DVD what do I need to add?
you'll probably want the universe repository & backports
backports means what? I thought it has something to do with old packages, no?
backports is more not-officially supported packages, but some very useful
if you're in synaptic check Settings > Repositories > Add & make sure everything is checked
that'll give you access to the widest range of supported programs for installation
thanks a lot for this tip of enabling the backports. It worked
